alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Monroe (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 4:47PM EST until February 21 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in New York... Black Creek At Churchville affecting Monroe and Genesee Counties. .Heavy rain and rapid snowmelt on Thursday will continue to result in high flows and flooding through the weekend. For the Black Creek...including Churchville...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black Creek At Churchville. * WHEN...Until late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Moderate flood, widespread agricultural flooding along entire length of creek. Some residential flooding begins Churchville to Chili area. Possible road closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM EST Saturday the stage was 7.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 PM EST Saturday was 7.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.6 feet on 03/23/1978. - For more information please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 445 AM EST.
